7 Responses to “Pat McAfee leaves $2.75 million on the table, potentially owes the Colts $400,000” adb1echer says: Feb 2, 2017 7:58 AM 
he’ll be swimming in the canal again in 18 months. His letter to his following reads like ‘I miss partying, I gotta get back at it’ amishninjas says: Feb 2, 2017 7:59 AM 
He’s not making 2.75 million writing for Barstool. streetyson says: Feb 2, 2017 8:18 AM 
LOL! The Barry Sanders Rule. Teams want all the advantages of using signing bonuses (essentially an enticement or “golden hello” to sign a contract) as a way to manipulate their cap, but none of the disadvantages of paying some or all of that money ahead of work done by the player. Some teams have claw-back clauses if a player retires etc, but then it isn’t really a signing bonus is it? Just another example of the dodgy-accounting by billionaires (or “financial imagineering” as they call it). jm91rs says: Feb 2, 2017 8:34 AM 
He certainly has the personality to make it in the media, just hope people take him seriously. Not a lot of ex-punters on those NFL pre-game shows. My guess is that he already has a job lined up. iejdaniel says: Feb 2, 2017 8:54 AM 
Wait. People can make more money talking about sports than actually playing the sport? Feb 2, 2017 8:55 AM
